item.title: By: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.dc:creator: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.description: Hi Jeremy, good to hear the AnkhSVN is a good choice. Hope to be writing the next post soon.<br /> Thanks for the feedback.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jeremy, good to hear the AnkhSVN is a good choice. Hope to be writing the next post soon.
Thanks for the feedback.

item.title: By: Jeremy Marx
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Marx
item.description: I'm rather looking forward to this as well, not having used the database project yet. I think Ankhsvn was a good choice; we've been using it successfully for several years to manage our SSIS and SSIS sources. I'd love to be able to extend it to our other database projects.
item.content:encoded: I’m rather looking forward to this as well, not having used the database project yet. I think Ankhsvn was a good choice; we’ve been using it successfully for several years to manage our SSIS and SSIS sources. I’d love to be able to extend it to our other database projects.

item.description: Hehe Jes, me neither. But let's see what we can learn ;)

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: I'm looking forward to this series. Source control is one of those things I don't know nearly enough about.
item.content:encoded: I’m looking forward to this series. Source control is one of those things I don’t know nearly enough about.

item.title: By: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.dc:creator: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.description: Thanks, I first saw the database projects when they were called: Visual Studio Team Edition for Database Professionals. I've seen a lot of customers who would benefit from this approach, I hope to convince them here.
item.content:encoded: Thanks, I first saw the database projects when they were called: Visual Studio Team Edition for Database Professionals. I’ve seen a lot of customers who would benefit from this approach, I hope to convince them here.

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: Good topic choice, I've been meaning to write up how I'm doing SQL versioning on one of the parallel personal projects I'm working on right now (powershell + t-sql), we need more information out there about the different options for this. Looking forward to the next post :)
item.content:encoded: Good topic choice, I’ve been meaning to write up how I’m doing SQL versioning on one of the parallel personal projects I’m working on right now (powershell + t-sql), we need more information out there about the different options for this. Looking forward to the next post ðŸ™‚
